channel.title: Rapid change of sight?
channel.description:
I turned off my computer and went to the bathroom. I came back, and picked up the latest popular science from my bed, and put on my glasses. But... I could barely read it! I took them off, and I could read it just fine.
^ The events that just took place. Note I still need them for seeing distances. Does anyone have any idea what this might be? And also, if it is permanent? So you know, it is mostly just like out of focus and stuff, and also I have astigmatism. [center][Yes, this is a serious post, true believers.][/center]

item.title: Rapid change of sight?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:201069”]Eye accommodation problems then?

Do you eyes just take a very, very long time to focus, or are they always the same?[/quote]
I found if i concentrate on something for a while, they focus and it’s pretty readable. But my sight did “flicker” around a bit today.

Read full topic

item.title: Rapid change of sight?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:13, topic:200078”]Great shit, thanks for asking. It takes time for the eyes to adjust after an operation so the way you see changes massively between the first couple of weeks.
@goatee: go fuck yourself, I was just telling him that these kinds of things happen to people who’ve been in an eye operation. I KNOW THAT HE HASN’T BEEN IN ONE.[/quote]

Go fuck myself? Christ someone gets a bit vunerable when they get things wrong.

Read full topic

What happened to you is normal, don’t worry about it.[/quote]
